explosives.rationale: Based on the classification by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (Division 1.1D, UN#0154) (no other data available). The substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -45. Its kick-off temperature and decomposition energy stand at 118degC and 5.1kJ/g, respectively, according to the Explosion Safety Database (2005) - i.e., explosives.

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 1.1D (UN#0154) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 300degC (ICSC, 1999)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 122degC (ICSC, 1999), test temperature: 140degC

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen. Not classified, based on the classification by UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (Division 1.1D, UN#0154)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 214 mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 492mg/kg (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (2001)), 283 mg/kg (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (2001)), 200mg/kg (DFGOT vol. 17 (2002)) and 290mg/kg (DFGOT vol. 17 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the results of rabbit eye irritation tests (ACGIH 7th (2001), DFGOT vol.17 (2002)): The irritation subsides within 24 hours.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the results of guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 98-30 (1999), DFGOT vol.17 (2002)) (skin sensitization: positive) and those of human skin sensitization teses (CERI Hazard Data 98-30 (1999), ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT Vol.17 (2002)) (skin sensitization: positive).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, blood system, kidney, liver), Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, blood system, kidney, liver) May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "headache, dizziness, dark urine and albuminuria, and if ingested in large quantities, destruction of red blood cells, gastroenteritis, hemorrhagic nephritis, acute hepatitis" (CERI Hazard Data 98-30 (1999)), "irritation to the eye and nasal mucosal" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), and the evidence from animal studies including "tremor, tonic/clonic spasm" (CERI Hazard Data 98-30 (1999)), "a decrease in locomotor activity, gait abnormality, clonic spasm, chromaturia (dark yellow), coloring of skin (yellow), abdominal position procumbent, decubitus position" (2001 Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (testis)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "anemia due probably to hemolysis and seminiferous tubular atrophy" (2001 Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=19.7mg/L of the crustacea (Mysid Shrimp)) (CERI Hazard Data, 1999).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although the acute toxicity was Category 3, judging from the NOEC=5mg/L during 21 days of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (ECETOC TR91, 2003), it was classified into Not classified.
